text: Hello All!
Anyone facings issues with getworkflow by  iD
api end point.
It's worked fine for me in the past, one thing I will say though is that the response might be a little different then what you're expecting
Like you can't create a workflow from the response of get a workflow by id
Thanks.
Also you can create a workflow with the contacts driven but not other objects
From the API?
Yes,,  when you use get all workflows .. only the contact driven apis listed
other apis.. like ticket driven are not listed there
Got it, let me check really quick

Interesting:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/v3/get_workflow>
atleast for the get workflow api that's your only option
Have you ever tried for non contact workflows
No, I haven't
Yep
I am going to dig some more..
lets see if I can figure out a way to come around
Yeah, let me know what you find. Honestly those api are legacy so I think there all pretty outdated, hopefully time for a upgrade
They are working on new setup of APIs.. not there yet..
My goal is to migrate husbpot sandbox workflows into HubSpot production with out having to recreate them manually in production
Yeah, that would be nice, but like I said that currently is impossible because of the api response for the get a workflow by id
it just doesn't have all the information you need to then send a create workflow request
Yep.. it should have been nicer to have .

did HubSpot disable the api tool in their docs?
part 1: I need to delete some custom object schemas and create new ones, but a lot of the options are locked out.

part 2: does the functionality still work in postman with the api key?

Hi all, new to group. Does anyone know if Professional Edition with the addition of Web Svs - both REST and SOAP will be enough for the integration to Salesforce? (and sorry If I should have started a new thread or something)! And this is for the marketing side, they already have the CRM with SF. There is an open API edition with SF, but the customer does not want to upgrade just purchase the API add-on.
Are you using a portal API key or a private app key?
portal API key, i have a private API key, but it looks like the tool itself is disabled for the test call

that test call button does not open at all, it did last week though. it's almost as if HubSpot is in the midst of retiring the api keys early to prevent people from using it before the deprecation in november, but i was relying on this tool to train people

i was able to delete and create the object schemas within postman still using the api key...

that being said i am new to all of this and wouldn't be sure how to make the delete request using the private app key in postman.

more just wanted to point out that this tool is basically useless right now from the dev docs
In the screenshot, it looks like you’re missing a required test value for the objectType field

even after putting it in, it didn't enable the button. before the test call was the _first thing_ i entered, too. now it cant be entered at all. and the "No Auth" is new, because nothing happens at all

Not sure then, but your assumption wouldn’t surprise me. That said, postman requests with private keys are pretty simple. Just navigate to the “authorization” tab, select “Bearer Token” from the dropdown, and input your private app key

FYI, we are aware of this :slightly_smiling_face:
I believe this one should be isolated to just the schemas endpoints now.
i made a quick and dirty video on how to create a schema in postman (includes a second of my daughter yelling at me even :laughing: ). (also enjoy 15 seconds of black screen)
oh and <@U03R0BBLKG8>, api key will work in postman if you have one
until november deadline
thank you <@UD53A9UUR> - very helpful!!
